Question: What is shown by a white reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The centre of the road
No passing
The far right side of the road

Question: You look in the mirror and see a cyclist – what should you do when opening the car door?

Answers.Answer: Open the door and expect the cyclist to stop
Open the door and expect the cyclist to swerve
Wait for the cyclist to go past before opening the door
Warn the cyclist by sounding the horn before opening the door

Question: What is the maximum distance a load may overhang your vehicle behind the rear axle?

Answers.Answer: 4 metres
5 metres
6 metres
7 metres

Question: Before making a lane change to your left, you must signal for at least 3 seconds. What else must you do?

Answers.Answer: Use your vehicle brake lights (stop lights) to warn other road users
Use your vehicle hazard lights to warn other road users
Check your blind spot before moving left
Ensure that there are no oncoming vehicles

Question: The warrant of fitness label for your car should be displayed at the:

Answers.Answer: top centre of the windscreen
left of the windscreen
top right corner of the windscreen
bottom centre of the windscreen

Question: This sign tells you that you are coming up to a railway level crossing. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Slow down so that you can look both ways to check that the crossing is clear
Speed up to drive over the crossing as quickly as possible
Stop to check whether the crossing is clear
Turn your vehicle indicators on before driving over the crossing

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: If you have had a flat tyre and have fitted a ‘space saver wheel’ what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive normally
Drive directly to a place where the flat tyre can be repaired and replaced
Drive at 40km/h until the flat tyre has been repaired
Lower the pressure in the other tyres

Question: What should you do when another vehicle is following you very closely?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get further ahead
Brake suddenly to warn them
Flick your vehicle lights and wave your arm
Slow down, move to the left and allow the vehicle to pass

Question: When must you pull over and allow an ambulance or fire engine to pass?

Answers.Answer: At all times
At an uncontrolled intersection
When it is operating its siren or flashing lights
When it is turning right and you have the right of way

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: What must you do when you come up to a red light showing at traffic signals?

Answers.Answer: Stop and then go on carefully
Go on slowly if no other traffic is coming
Stop only if other vehicles are coming from the right
Stop and wait until it changes to a green light

Question: What may you do at traffic signals if there is a green arrow pointing to the right and a red light showing at the same time?

Answers.Answer: You may turn right
You may go straight ahead
You must stop until all lights turn green
You may turn left or right

Question: Which one of the following vehicles can you drive on a car licence?

Answers.Answer: A moped
A motorbike
A truck with dangerous goods
A bus

Question: If you are going straight through a roundabout don’t signal as you come up to the roundabout, only signal left as you pass the exit before the one you wish to take.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: A police officer can impound your car on the spot if you are caught driving while disqualified.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: If you tow another vehicle, what is the maximum distance allowed between the two vehicles?

Answers.Answer: 1 metre
2 metres
3 metres
4 metres

Question: At night, a towed vehicle must:

Answers.Answer: have a red light at the back
have its hazard lights on
be sounding its horn
be travelling slower than 50km/h

Question: You must NOT open the door of your motor vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: you are parked within 10 metres of a bus stop
you are likely to scratch the paint of your vehicle
the car radio in your vehicle is playing loud music
you are likely to hurt any person

Question: You are driving on a country road at night when your vehicle headlights suddenly go out. What is the safest thing to do?

Answers.Answer: Carry on driving to the nearest garage with your vehicle hazard lights on
Slow down and drive on the far left side of the road
Carry on driving to the nearest garage with your vehicle’s interior lights on
Slow down, move off the road gradually, stop and turn your vehicle hazard lights on

Question: When coming to a pedestrian crossing with a raised traffic island in the middle, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to pedestrians who are on your half of the road
Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road
Remain stopped until the pedestrian has reached the other side of the road
Drive on as pedestrians will give way to all on coming traffic

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: Children’s playground ahead
Railway station ahead
Railway level crossing ahead
Railway museum ahead

Question: What does the legal definition of a road include?

Answers.Answer: Streets and motorways
Bridges and car parks
Beaches
All of the above

Question: When parking downhill on a steep road, what does the road code suggest that you should do?

Answers.Answer: Leave your keys in the vehicle in case the brakes fail
Turn the front wheels of your vehicle away from the kerb and leave the vehicle in first gear
Turn the front wheels of your vehicle towards the kerb and leave the vehicle in reverse gear
Leave the wheels of your vehicle straight ahead and make sure that the handbrake is on

Question: When a flock of sheep are coming towards you on a country road, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Sound the horn on your vehicle to move them out the way
Slow down or pull over to the side of the road
Turn on your vehicle hazard lights and drive on
Drive down the centre of the road

Greasy surface
Left-hand lane closed

Question: What is the purpose of the 2-second rule?

Answers.Answer: To provide a safe following distance between vehicles traveling at the same speed
To ensure that vehicles have sufficient stopping time when approaching intersections
To avoid gridlocks in congested driving areas
To ensure the speed limit is observed
